website_summaries.verdict: Spearheading the return of lace-up bike shoes, the Empire ACC is considered an iconic model. Apart from being a trail-blazer, its lightweight construct is decked out with essential features. Impeccable power transfer, optimal comfort, and reflective components are some of its main strengths.Other than a few complaints due to the laces’ relatively fixed design, the majority find it as one of the better road shoes they’ve tried.
pros: Almost all of the reviews state that the Giro Empire ACC is a comfortable shoe on and off the bike
Most wearers have praised this pair’s adequately stiff sole
They find that it has excellent power transfer while pedaling and flex when walking
It is great looking, according to many purchasers
Plenty of consumers rave about the reflective color options
They recognize its safety function and how it enhances the footwear’s overall style
Numerous users have lauded the Empire ACC for its lightweight build
The shoe’s interchangeable arch support system is perceived to be ingenious by several reviewers
They attest how helpful it is to get that comfortable fit
A handful of commenters find the shoe’s superior material quality and its other good traits to be the logic for its excellent value for money
It is fairly ventilated, according to some wearers
A few cyclists love the retro lace closure as it prevents hotspots and distributes pressure evenly
Replaceable heel pads are a plus as they allow longer lifespan, according to a number of riders
cons: Several cyclists who are used to on-the-fly adjustments find this pair’s lace closures as something to get used to
A few buyers have claimed that their pair had some construction flaws such as glue showing and different shaped heel cups

customer_reviews.title: Well made, look great. Nice bag.
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted another pair of Sidi's but these had great reviews and so far, I really like them. They are the most expensive pair of shoes I've ever had, so the expectation is high. And I am happy. I can't think of anything I don't like about them. The bag (case) is really nice. I keep them in it. The laces take time to tie, so they wouldn't make a good shoe for short triathlons. But other than that, I like 'em a lot. I bought a 48, they feel the same size as Sidis 47, for what it is worth. Love the retro laces verses all the stupid clasps that other shoes have.
customer_reviews.author: RunPatRun

customer_reviews.title: Amazing and ... tedious
customer_reviews.text: This was my first pair of lace-up cycling shoes, and, as I expected, they are super comfortable and super tedious. I change shoes several times a day, and these actually have to be unlaced to put on or take off, even after they're broken in. Might not seem like much time, but it adds up. Having said that, these are probably the most comfortable, and best performing, cycling shoes I've ever owned in almost 20 years of riding road bikes. Is the added comfort worth the hassle of the laces? I guess so. Depends on how many times you have to put them on each day...
customer_reviews.author: J. Rowe

customer_reviews.title: Way too tight for an average width foot
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted these shoes to be comfortable. I have other Giro and Shimano shoes and every pair is a 41, so I ordered a 41.5 knowing these run small. Length wise they fit OK, but after 45 minutes on a trainer both of my feet were numb around the sides. I tried again the next day and left the laces very loose, but still had the same problem. I love how they look and the adjustability of the laces, plus they are incredibly light. In the end I had to send them back.
customer_reviews.author: Christian Clark

customer_reviews.title: Giro Love
customer_reviews.text: Great fitting pair of cycling kicks. I like how the lace up allows you to really customize your fit. After about 4 weeks the shoe has developed a shape for your foot. Aesthetically, I love the look. Clean and simple lines. Probably the only downside is that it's not the most ventilated pair of shoes you could get. Your feet will be a little sweaty on a warm summer day.
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: The length feels comfortable but the width squeezes my pinkie toe after 20+ ...
customer_reviews.text: I guess my feet are on the wider side. The length feels comfortable but the width squeezes my pinkie toe after 20+ mile rides. Product is great aesthetically, after the binding of my past cycling shoes broke I switched to laces. It is a bit more time consuming to get the ideal snugness but it surprisingly does not let up afterwards.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Luong

customer_reviews.title: Cool retro-look with high tech features.
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are stiff and light. The Easton carbon fiber soles really help transmit the power to your pedals. The lacing system helps to tailor the fit to your foot, and there is no issue with them requiring further adjustment during your ride. Came with two sets of laces (black and orange), but I bought bright yellow laces from Giro to match my kit.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: The best cycling shoes I've ever had!
customer_reviews.text: Incredibly comfortable cycling shoes. These are the third pair I've bought in the past 6 months because the first two hurt my feet. These are just like a miracle on your feet. Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: greatwhite

customer_reviews.title: Comfort with maximum it flow for cool feet.
customer_reviews.text: Love the color and the retro styling, being a cyclist in my upper 50's have always had the Velcro or easy ratchet styled shoes but was so drawn to the retro look with modern styling and have to say Giro went above and beyond my imagination with the Empire Acc road cycling shoes; these are by far the most comfortable and stylish shoes ever, providing great air flow not only on the top side but by means of an under toe air vent well worth every penny spent cool feet and not forgetting to mention the envious comments of my fellow roadies.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Clarke

customer_reviews.title: Giro: The go to cycling shoe brand for this guy.
customer_reviews.text: As usual giro producing one hell of a product. Shoes are a little snug of course but once they are broken in I expect to get the exact same performance from these as I do from my other pair of giro cycling shoes. The color is so bright and the black splatter design on the back is reflective material which is awesome because I thought it was just patten leather like the rest of the shoes upper half.
customer_reviews.author: Antonio J. Solano

customer_reviews.title: a shoe is damaged
customer_reviews.text: Greetings, I bought the giro empire acc blue steel in December. I could not use them because of the Hurricane Maria that happened in Puerto Rico.at this moment I realize that one of the shoes came with a defect where the grip. How can you help me make a claim with the Giro?
customer_reviews.author: William Cora

customer_reviews.title: Stiff and comfy
customer_reviews.text: Super comfortable, lightweight, and stiff. Feels great on the pedals. The adjustable arch support is a godsend!
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended shoes
customer_reviews.text: Great cycling shoes. They are very comfortable and have no need to adjust the laces while riding.
customer_reviews.author: José Fernando Meneses Romero

customer_reviews.title: I love my GIRO EMPIRE ACC shoe
customer_reviews.text: I've been waiting for a sale and my patience paid off with a great price. Excellent shoes and extremely light weight. Easton EC90 carbon sole. Very cool retro looking shoe with modern performance.
customer_reviews.author: David V.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Amazing shoes, the reflector material work great just like they way it has been advertised
customer_reviews.author: Shahriar Davidesfahani

customer_reviews.title: Best Cycling Shoe on the market!
customer_reviews.text: These cycling shoes are the absolute best ever! I love having shoe laces along with the sleek style of the shoe. They're incredibly comfortable, durable, and make for long rides.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My favorite cycling shoes
customer_reviews.text: My favorite cycling shoes! I wear a 43.5 and they were a tad bit tight the first wear. But now they're absolutely amazing!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: BEST cycling shoes
customer_reviews.text: These are the BEST cycling shoes I have ever owned! I have flat and wide feet. They run small so go 1 size up. This is my second pair.
customer_reviews.author: Noel Quintero

customer_reviews.title: Great looking shoe
customer_reviews.text: I'm loving this shoe very comfortable, first time I wore it I did 155 miles for 9 hours, it was comfortable all day great looking shoe and I'm happy.
customer_reviews.author: Spartacus

customer_reviews.title: Best cycling shoes I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: Best cycling shoes I've ever owned. I could talk about stiffness for weeks. I suggest ordering a size larger they run small.
customer_reviews.author: Chester

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Too narrow for me, and very difficult to adjust on the fly.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Blankenship

customer_reviews.title: Awesome shoes. Very comfortable and very stiff sole
customer_reviews.text: Awesome shoes. Very comfortable and very stiff sole. I use them riding around Chicago streets and the reflective finish helps keep you visible when it gets dark.
customer_reviews.author: Conradderrs

customer_reviews.title: Poor warranty service from seller.
customer_reviews.text: I had a pretty bad experience with this shoe, I got unlucky with poor construction/glue (it happens, no biggie). The sole delaminated from the body of the shoe. After repeat attempts to contact the original seller, I am now forced to contact Giro directly, which I guess I should have done so originally. Super disappointed by the seller for not taking care of me after repeat discussions and pictures going back and forth. You can view the photo that shoes the carbon sole separating from the body of the shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor R.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Fit, I broke my before records on Strava
customer_reviews.text: It was an excellent choice, shoes comes with extra footbed, allow better fit.
customer_reviews.author: Oscar

customer_reviews.title: They are fantastic. The fit is perfect
customer_reviews.text: These are my first pair of cycling shoes and I think I've outdone myself. They are fantastic. The fit is perfect, they are comfortable on long rides and look great!
customer_reviews.author: Eric G.

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and stylish
customer_reviews.text: These bike shoes were purchased as a Christmas present for my 30 year old son. He absolutely loves them. Comfortable and stylish.
customer_reviews.author: NikkiD

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Reflective paint finish condition was not good. But the idea of the product was good.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful Shoes. Most comfortable pair of cycling shoes I've owned.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Menker

customer_reviews.title: U MUST HAVEM🚴🏻🚵🏼
customer_reviews.text: From the first millisecond I tried these babies on, I was HOOKED! The 45 is my size and they fit like should and based on the reviews and size suggestions I find NO FAULT in my size in fact at even a half size smaller would work. AWESOME SHOE, PERFECT SIZE, TRUE TO SIZE(if you have a narrow foot) ❤️❤️❤️❤️These I'm going to purchase another pair. COMFORTABLE, LIGHTWEIGHT, WELL BUILT CONSTRUCTION ALL AROUND! DO HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS FOR EVERY CYCLIST. BEGINNER OR PRO🚴🏻🚴🏻🚴🏻🚴🏻🚴🏻🚴🏻🚴🏻🚴🏻🚴🏻
customer_reviews.author: RICK Moses

customer_reviews.title: ... used on a few rides but so far they're great.
customer_reviews.text: Only used on a few rides but so far they're great.
customer_reviews.author: WSilver

customer_reviews.title: but the 45 GIRO ACC seems like it might be a go
customer_reviews.text: have been wearing a northwave extreme tech for two seasons. Giro has slightly smaller toe box. A bit slimmer fit. I wear an 11. Ordered 44.5, sent back for a 45. i have long toe genetics. SIDI is not a shoe for my foot, but the 45 GIRO ACC seems like it might be a go.
customer_reviews.author: ape

customer_reviews.title: the fit is perfect and very light
customer_reviews.text: 4,1/2 stars, excellents, the fit is perfect and very light
customer_reviews.author: Hernan Lopez Medina

customer_reviews.title: Not for wide foot with high arch.
customer_reviews.text: I purchase these lace shoes hoping they would fit my wide foot with very high instep/arch. Lace normally conforms better. In this case the front of the shoe is on the narrow side. My foot would not fit in the shoe. Probably fine for a smaller narrower foot but not for wide/high foot. Wish they made a wide version.
customer_reviews.author: John D.

customer_reviews.title: ... some break in time and I got a few bad hot spots last weekend as a result
customer_reviews.text: They need some break in time and I got a few bad hot spots last weekend as a result, but the fit is otherwise good. Also, the sole seems slightly thinner than my Sidis so I lowered my saddle just a tiny bit and that seemed to do the trick.
customer_reviews.author: Kimio Bazett

customer_reviews.title: Pair made in heaven!
customer_reviews.text: These are dream shoes. The fit, finish and power transfer are out of this world. Not to mention the retro looks. There is a reason why Giro charge what they charge. I've had north waves and fizik but these are the best. Do your self a favor and buy them
customer_reviews.author: Hardik R. Vadel

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe
customer_reviews.text: Most comfortable cycling shoe I have ever owned. Love being able to adjust the laces to tighten or loosen as needed.
customer_reviews.author: Mark H. Morris

customer_reviews.title: Bad design and. Poor fit
customer_reviews.text: Bought these and a pair of Fizik’s at the same time. The Giro’s had poor quality and did not fit well at all.
customer_reviews.author: J. Sova

customer_reviews.title: Nice upper & stiff sole but not too breathable and narrow toe box
customer_reviews.text: First the good. The upper is soft and comfy with laces to dial in fit unlike any ratchet, Boa or Velcro system. There's also two sets of laces to fit your mood and they conveniently tuck in an elastic tab. The insole has different interchangeable arches that slide in/out pocket but I still went with my Specialized BG insert. The carbon sole is completely stiff with one vent up front no worries there. Despite the vent and perforations in the upper this show does not breathe real well. I leave them home when it's above 85 degrees. Also, the toe box is a little narrow for my taste.
customer_reviews.author: Dat Duong

customer_reviews.title: Best shoes ever!
customer_reviews.text: Holy cow these shoes are COMFORTABLE! Buy one size larger than normal. Very stiff for maximum performance but ultra comfortable for endurance rides. Do yourself a favor and buy them.
customer_reviews.author: NYoda

customer_reviews.title: The shoe is way to narrow. Tried it in ...
customer_reviews.text: The shoe is way to narrow. Tried it in 2 different sizes. If you have a wider foot forget about these shoes.
customer_reviews.author: carolyn

customer_reviews.title: Otherwise seemed like great shoes
customer_reviews.text: The toe box in particular was too narrow for me, so it was clear I had to return them as soon as I tried them on. Otherwise seemed like great shoes, given that I didn't ever have a chance to ride in them.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Y.

customer_reviews.title: Chapeau Giro, for releasing a comfortable high performance and stylish cycling shoe.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic, well executed shoe that accommodates a wider toe box and high arch/forefoot in part to using laces in the design. The carbon sole, while not as stiff as the bathtub design of a Bont, more than adequately transfers power, and does so with comfortable and customizable insoles. A shoe bag, and extra pair of laces are included, adding a very "pro" touch to the product. I've enjoyed these shoes so much, I invested in the MTB version as well.
customer_reviews.author: Kristina Young

customer_reviews.title: Awesome shoe. Looks & fits great (size 14)
customer_reviews.text: Awesome shoe. Looks & fits great (size 14). Throwback lace ups are sweet on the track.
customer_reviews.author: William Pack

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: So far I really like the shoes. The fit is great and the shoes are extremely comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Ernst

customer_reviews.title: They had a little scratch on the sole,
customer_reviews.text: They had a little scratch on the sole, but besode that the fit is exellent
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best ever biking shoes BUT...
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair (different color). Best ever biking shoes. Ultra-adjustable. BUT... Edit to my earlier review: BUT, the little heel pad that screws in to the bottom of the shoe has about worn out, quite understandably from scraping it when I clip-out and my shoe hits the road surface. I called GIRO and they want $25 for this little part of the shoe. C'mon, GIRO, do you really want to alienate your loyal customers by charging what seems to me to be such an absurd price for a simple little replacement part that I would guess you buy in bulk for a fraction of what you want for a replacement? GIRO, please comment.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Worst product ever
customer_reviews.text: Worst product I have ever purchased. Horrbile fit. 60 day fit guarantee from Giro is BS. Amazon is unresponsive. Two of the screws holding cleats in the bottom of the shoe broke off. Worst shoe ever made by man. Better off with any other shoe, from any otehr brand.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I blame New Mexico for having poor roads.
customer_reviews.text: First time I wore these I hit a pothole and suffered a concussion, bruised ribs, and severe road rash. Clearly no fault of the shoes. I blame New Mexico for having poor roads.
customer_reviews.author: Keylor

product_meta.title: Giro Empire Acc Mens Cycling Shoes
product_meta.description: One glance at Giro's Empire ACC Shoes, and you'll see they're different. Rather than the ubiquitous buckle/strap combo, Giro's outfitted them with something decidedly old-fashioned -- laces. That's about where the old-fashioned nature stops, though. The uppers are a single piece of Evofiber microfiber, which is highly breathable, but is also perforated for additional airflow. Those uppers are attached to an ultra-stiff Easton EC90 ACC Carbon Sole. This sole is among the stiffest available, and due to high grade of carbon fiber used in its construction, is also one of the slimmest, producing a stack height of just 6. 5mm. Between the uppers and the sole sits Giro's lauded SuperNatural FitKit, the long name for its user-tunable footbed. These insoles have swappable arch support so you can tune the fit of your shoes precisely to your feet.
feature_bullets: Sole: Easton EC90 ACC carbon fiber
